description: When it's working it's great...

The deb version and the AppImage 2.6.1 from Openshot website both had issues but the flatpack version 2.6.1 from https://flatpak.org works for me on Ubuntu 22.No clue why, so will use that until the deb version is fixed.
summary: https://flatpak.org version works on Ubuntu 22 for me

description: An awesome editor with a very nice user interface for those that want to use something that's simpler than Kdenlive.

Each time I tried to add a clip for editing, OpenShot froze. Eventually a Ubuntu message would pop-up and say "The video editor OpenShot is not responding," with option buttons to Wait or Force Close. I gave it an honest try, rebooting, and waiting, but it simply wouldn't do anything beyond loading.
summary: OpenShot wouldn't run on my desktop computer

description: SOOO BUGGY. CRASHES. AUDIO LAG. SUCKS AT RENDERING. REMOVE IT.

I didn't do much video editing before, but recently needed to edit a video, just to trim the edges of the video. I tried with another software, and probably couldn't figure out how to do that, and it ended up rendering the completed file in 1.5 hours. Whereas, I was straight into the task with OpenShot and it handled the job a lot more quickly. Then I discovered a lot more features from the youtube channel and what I liked it achieving the same function in multiple ways, which is like linux, gives choices to the user. Awesome!
summary: Beginner friendly and full of features

this app is best in 2020.it is so good

description: I loaded a simple MP4 file to edit. The editor could not play the video without huge stuttering. Attempts to simply splice sections of the video in the UI had lags of 10+ seconds. It was simply unusable. I can't imagine doing real work with this.

I love this, but it is really sad that you have to go to their website to get the updated version. It is easy to use and really have what we amateurs need. Please update it here in Ubuntu Software or this will die away like so many others who make it difficult for users to download and update.
summary: Love it but update it here

description: I can't even start the app.
It looks like a good editor, but I can't use it. It crashes almost immediately I start working.

Does not start when installed from package manager on OpenSuse
Maybe the appimage will work???

I don't usually review software on Ubuntu Software, but seeing OpenShot sitting at 3 stars is just not right. 

I use it to edit the videos I create for courses I deliver. I merge and cut multiple videos/audio sources and even used it to censor out parts of the screen that were confidential in video as they moved around. I am no video editor, this is not even like a side job for me but I was able to do it thanks to Openshot.

It has everything you need, so its user interface is a bit complex compared to more app like software. Other than that I don't see any reason why it wouldn't be a 5 star piece of software.
Randomly crashed during working or when I try to export a video.

This software is *horrendously* slow. For context, I'm editing a simple 4 minute, 1080p video, and just to adjust the scale of the video (because OpenShot decides to scale down a 1080p video by almost half, even when using a 1080p viewing profile), it takes on average 20-30 seconds for each action, due to the software locking up. And before anyone mentions my hardware, I have a GTX 3080 and a Ryzen 7 5800X, with 32 GB of RAM. This is terrible software, avoid at all costs, *literally*!
summary: Horribly slow and prone to crashing

description: It worked completely fine under Windows, but now under Arch Linux it doesn't work at all. :(

OpenShot is a very usable and dependable video editor. I've been using it for several years now on my hobby video editing. Does everything I need and it's a lot more than simple video cutting. Would like to give 5 stars but it's sometimes a little buggy, not enough to annoy, though.

I'm coming from Power Director 19, looking for a good video editor for Linux. Something more than just basic trimming. I thought OpenShot was it but for the life of me I can't figure out why transitions don't work as expected. Overlapping two segments will produce a good cross fade, but trying to implement any transition across segments from the presets causes weird wonky results. Maybe I'm missing something. I'll give it a bit more time and revisit if I figure out why transitions aren't working correctly.
It crashed some times but not that much.
So bad even for basic cut-and-trim editing.

Great app;
 occasionally when trying to export a file, it will crash, but not often
Used to work fine but this version and the AppImage version is getting hung up after some time or if any new modification is tried

Le logiciel répondait parfaitement à mes besoins, jusqu'au moment où il est devenu impossible de le lancer. Je n'arrive même pas à le désinstaller.

J'ai réussi à surmonter le problème d'ouverture dans Ubuntu 22.04 en téléchargeant la version 2.6.1 à partir du site web du logiciel (AppImage). Ensuite il faut cocher dans les propriétés du document : Permissions / Autoriser l'exécution du fichier comme un programme.

Ne fonctionne pas sous Kubuntu. Dommage l'application est super.
depuis ubuntu 22.04 et les mises à jour ne fonctionne plus du tout. L'installation est interminable et ensuite le click sur l'icone n'entraine aucune réaction...
Très simple d'utilisation
Désynchronisation image/son

Mon ordi marche impecable avec KDenlive et ShotCut sans aucuns problémes. L'utilisation d'OpenShot est catastrophique : ralentissement puis plantage complet, il faut redémarrer pour se sortir de ce mauvais pas. Fuyez et ne perdez pas votre temps avec un soft autant buggé.Pourquoi le proposer au téléchargement ?

Logiciel plutôt facile à prendre en main.
Le logiciel dispose de pas mal de fonctions comme rajouter des titres, faire des transitions diverses, fondu d'une vidéo sur l'autre, séparation de l'audio de la vidéo et gestion de l a luminosité/contraste/chroma.

On réalise ce qu'on appelle un montage avec des fichiers audios, vidéos et des images et on peut convertir les fichiers en plus. Bien sûr, suivant les capacités de l'ordinateur et il a parfois une lecture difficile quand on teste mais quand on exporte le fichier tout est bon.

Très aisé de prise en main.
Utilisation facile et fiable.
Très gourmand en ressources.
Plantage sur les grosses vidéos.
